byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Syrian rebels, aided by Turkish air strikes, push deeper into country's north, advancing on terrirory held by Syrian Kurds; advance pits two Syrian groups backed by American government, rebel groups and Kurdish militias, against one another.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Aided by Turkish airstrikes, Syrian rebels pressed deeper into the northern part of the country, putting two American-backed forces in conflict.
snippet: Aided by Turkish airstrikes, Syrian rebels pressed deeper into the northern part of the country, putting two American-backed forces in conflict....

headline.main: In Syria, Rebels Threaten Kurdish-Controlled Territory as U.S. Allies Clash
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Threaten Territory Held by Kurds, in a Clash of U.S. Allies
